class_notes:
Music majors: this course counts as a Category C.


This course is in the Arts and Social Justice Fellows program for the Fall 2022 semester. Students will have the opportunity to work with an Atlanta artist and explore social justice issues relevant to the course topic.


This course serves as an introduction to the theory and practice of ethnography in ethnomusicology. Through focused reading and creative fieldwork exercises, students will develop their understanding of ethnographic research methodologies and approaches to representing musical experience through writing.
course_description: This course examines the theories and methodologies in the field of ethnomusicology, with a focus on how it intersects with other disciplines and the broader social content.
prerequisites: MUS 200 or MUS_OX 200 or equivalent transfer credit as prerequisite.
